channel.title: Comments on: sips – Mac OS X CLI Image Manipulation Tool

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/04/22/sips-mac-os-x-cli-image-manipulation-tool/#comment-3409">Ben Lavery</a>.
True, looks like at least 10.4 - http://developer.apple.com/mac/library/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/10.4/man1/sips.1.html?useVersion=10.4 - but the drop down for selecting OS X versions only goes back to 10.4, so I'm still not sure when it first showed up.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ben Lavery.

True, looks like at least 10.4 – http://developer.apple.com/mac/library/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/10.4/man1/sips.1.html?useVersion=10.4 – but the drop down for selecting OS X versions only goes back to 10.4, so I’m still not sure when it first showed up.

item.title: By: Ben Lavery
item.dc:creator: Ben Lavery
item.description: It looks like sips has been around since OS X v10.4 judging by the online man page (you can view different versions of the man page and it goes back to 10.4).
item.content:encoded: It looks like sips has been around since OS X v10.4 judging by the online man page (you can view different versions of the man page and it goes back to 10.4).
